Thanks, Gordon for your reply.
> A crawler collecting many valueless URIs deep on 'trap' paths will have
> a larger state directory, so keeping an eye on the largest queues, and
> adding mid-crawl adjustments to either � (1) block more unwanted URIs
> from being enqueued; or (2) quickly discard unwanted URIs from where
> they've collected � may help shrink your state directory significantly.
>

I can get the largest queues from frontier summary report interface. 
But, how can I block URIs from being queued or even discard unwanted URIs?

Thanks in advance.

--
